extendedIngredients.name: olive oil

title: Chile-roasted Shrimp
summary: Chile-roasted Shrimp is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe with 10 servings. One portion of this dish contains roughly 10g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 112 calories. For $1.17 per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. If you have butter, oregano, juice of lemon, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 28 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 20%. This score is not so spectacular. Similar recipes are Garlic Roasted Shrimp With Red Chile Oil, Roasted Shrimp with Chile Gremolata, and Roasted Shrimp with Chile Gremolata.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Maysaran Arsheen Pinot Gris. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Maysara Arsheen Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A bright expression of fruit right up front, greeting your palate with notes of cut grass on a warm day. The wine is anchored by crisp acidity, but not so much as to overpower a fleeting tease of sweetness that leaves you smiling. Arsheen has a smart, refreshing character that will bestow clarity to a range of preparations of fish, fowl, and pork.

instructions: Combine 1/4 cup olive oil and next 7 ingredients in a large bowl, and toss well. Cover with plastic wrap, and chill at least 2 hours or up to 6 hours.                                                                                                 Preheat oven to 450. Place a 15- x 10-inch jellyroll pan in oven 10 minutes or until extremely hot. Carefully spread shrimp in a single layer across pan. Bake 8 minutes, stirring once halfway through cooking.                                                                                                 Remove from oven, and immediately add stock or water, butter, and remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to pan. Stir well. Serve in shallow bowls with good bread and cold beer or dry German Riesling.

steps.step: Combine 1/4 cup olive oil and next 7 ingredients in a large bowl, and toss well. Cover with plastic wrap, and chill at least 2 hours or up to 6 hours.
Place a 15- x 10-inch jellyroll pan in oven 10 minutes or until extremely hot. Carefully spread shrimp in a single layer across pan.
Bake 8 minutes, stirring once halfway through cooking.
Remove from oven, and immediately add stock or water, butter, and remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to pan. Stir well.
Serve in shallow bowls with good bread and cold beer or dry German Riesling.
